title: Add text formatting controls in admin panel for homepage sections

requirements.summary: Create a new 'Text Formatting' tab in the admin panel alongside existing sections
acceptanceCriteria: A new tab labeled 'Text Formatting' appears in the AdminPanel component
The tab is accessible alongside other existing admin tabs
Clicking the tab displays the text formatting controls

file_operations.description: Add a new tab labeled 'Text Formatting' to the existing tab list in AdminPanel. Insert it after the existing tabs (Content, Hero Theme, Clinics, Services, Reviews, Social Media, Footer) and wire it to display the TextFormattingManager component when selected.

requirements.summary: Create TextFormattingManager admin component with section-based controls for font size, font family, font weight, letter spacing, and text transform
acceptanceCriteria: Component displays separate subsections for hero, overview/about, services, and footer
Each subsection has separate controls for 'Headings' and 'Body Text'
Controls include inputs for font size (px), font family dropdown, font weight dropdown, letter spacing (em), and text transform options
Changes can be previewed and saved per section
A save button persists all formatting changes to the backend

file_operations.description: Create a new admin component that fetches the current HomepageTextFormatting using the getHomepageTextFormatting backend method. Display four subsections: 'Hero Section', 'Overview/About Section', 'Services Section', and 'Footer Section'. For each subsection, provide two groups of controls: 'Headings' and 'Body Text'. Each group includes input fields for font size (number input in px), font family (dropdown with common web fonts like Arial, Helvetica, Georgia, Times New Roman, Courier New, Verdana, etc.), font weight (dropdown with 'normal' and 'bold' options), letter spacing (number input in em), and text transform (dropdown with 'none', 'uppercase', 'lowercase', 'capitalize' options). Map the subsections to the backend fields: heroHeading, heroBody, overviewHeading, overviewBody, servicesHeading, servicesBody, footerHeading, footerBody. Include a save button that calls updateHomepageTextFormatting mutation with the modified HomepageTextFormatting object. Display loading states and error handling.

Add two new hooks: useGetHomepageTextFormatting (query hook that calls actor.getHomepageTextFormatting) and useUpdateHomepageTextFormatting (mutation hook that calls actor.updateHomepageTextFormatting and invalidates the 'homepageTextFormatting' query key on success). Follow the existing pattern used for other query and mutation hooks in the file.

requirements.summary: Apply stored text formatting settings to Hero component's text elements
acceptanceCriteria: Hero headline applies heading formatting from hero section settings
Hero subtext applies body formatting from hero section settings
Formatting updates dynamically when settings change
Blog pages remain unaffected

file_operations.description: Fetch HomepageTextFormatting using useGetHomepageTextFormatting hook. Apply heroHeading formatting (fontSize, fontFamily, fontWeight, letterSpacing, textTransform) to the headline element using inline styles. Apply heroBody formatting to the subtext element using inline styles. Ensure the formatting is applied dynamically when the query data updates. This component is only used on the homepage, not on blog pages.

Apply footerHeading formatting (fontSize, fontFamily, fontWeight, letterSpacing, textTransform) to all footer section heading elements using inline styles. Apply footerBody formatting to footer body text elements including contact info, links, and copyright text using inline styles.
